intro: Howdy? Here, I'm all about programming, running, doing magic and diabolo tricks. That's it. Since life is so unforgiving, I rather do my shit wrong anyway. Good vibes, dudes!

post.body: There is a strange feeling while browsing ZN. A feeling of "such an amazing thing can't exist". But here we are :3
Before asking who's to blame for a problem, find a way to solve it
Embrace your dreams. If you want to be a hero, you need to have dreams
There was an issue with Tor and Zeronet, some problems with the control auth cookie... Glad it's working again!
Do I really, really need Netbeans for programming? No. Will I use it because I'm a lazy fuck? Absolutely.
Have you ever tried to be more productive, have a daily schedule and take control over your life? I did, it sucked
"The risk was calculated, but man I'm bad at math"
Can't stop listening to Avantasia's "Let The Storm Descend Upon You". It's been a while since a music captivated me this much :)
What a goddamn long week! I'm literally out of batteries here. Gotta do some cool stuff to recharge.

There is one thing you should always consider while growing up: "People are mere tools to achieve greater amounts of money and everyone is racing towards success. Work is not meant to be enjoyable, it's meant to be productive". Now add "MY ASS" right at the end of all this bullshit and ur good to go!
Sharing content programatically on Facebook should be on the "how to make someone suffer from ultimately frustation" top 10

I think there should be a blur effect here on ZeroMe before opening image contents. Right now it feels like a porn version of russian roulette (I mean, there is 1 to 6 chances you will actually see a "normal" image)
Ah, the sweet sweet sensation of a non maskering input with jquery (yes, I'm still using it and yes, I'm still downloading minified versions of plugins and loading them by script tags)
And then you realize you've been using something like "name='masked-class'", and trying to reference that shit with jQuery. Sitting down here, looking at my code, I just noticed: I'm a dumb fuck
I should be sleeping. Pretty certain the future version of me will be cursing the shit of the actual version of me. Still not sleeping, tho...

Is this really happening? Look around, there are people posting what they want, dozens of decentralized zites, an engaged community and a polished interface for the end users (look at this zite, it's fucking beautiful! Look at ZeroHello, damn it!). There are discussions, there are ideas (all the kind of ideas LOL), there is CONTENT. Freedom... individual and collective freedom. I'm glad to be here, dudes, it's amazing! Thanks!
Here we go again... No sleeping for good old orbit. Maybe someday I'll learn to fucking focus and take control over my lif... Nah, Spongebob is on!

comment.body: This is pretty much a fail. Next post please
@jad: LOL That's halfway through! I guess you should keep dreaming... For science, u know?
@jad: no sleep, no science, just dreams \õ/
@jad: Hey, I think @noftsh (@nofish) and/or @p2p can answer those
@jad: Contacting them on github would be the best approach. Maybe you should post those question at ZeroTalk too, since they are very community relatable (or ask Shydoo to do so)
@Realjohndoe: Nah, just the blur would work

@Realjohndoe: Imagine this dialog: "Hey dude, would you like to see some adult content on your feed?", "Why yes! I'd love to!", "Great! Click here and see it". Then another dude passes by... "And what about you? Want some adult content?", "Not right now, I'm kinda busy. Maybe next time!". They all get what they want, they all respect each other... Isn't it great? *---* . That's my point. There is no need for censorship when we care about the kind of content other want to see (and the ones they don't too)

But you kinda right here... Just because someone don't like something (well, at least not ALL THE TIME LOL) it doesn't mean there should be some sort of blur or stuff. Anyway, I was just joking here, we can move on to the next pic-or-porn post with smiles in our faces
@Orbit: on our faces... I'm not good at this "talking" stuff

Here's an #idea: First of all, this should be something configurable BY USER. We don't want to enforce content rules, we just want individual content filter. Something like "Enable safe preview" or "Enable blur filter" somewhere would be awesome. Maybe add a scrollable blur effect (a slider control below image content. Left means blurry, right means plain)... I'll see if I can code something like that xD
It works! ZeroNet is listening on port 43110

@Jetten: LMAO new porn concept: blurry. Unfortunately I think hentai got there first... Anyway, right now I try to guess from the bottom of the image if it's porn or not, good enough I guess. Blurry would be better but you have a point there, that would turn this russian roulette into an adult version of "Who is that pokemon". But, IMO, tagging is a little too aggressive... It's a community-wide content filter. <enphasis>OF COURSE</enphasis> that doesn't mean tagging is a bad idea. I just wanted to think about something like "personal filters". Guess I just have to follow people with the kind of content I like and keep away from the "porn battle royale" (but not too far away, lol)
